page.title: 12GODSHILL SHOW
page.content: Godshill and District Horticultural Society holds its 72nd Summer Show of Fruit, Flowers and Vegetables this year. By kind permission of local farmers it has been held in various fields around the village where the new Telephone Exchange and various housing estates now stand. In 1952 the Society acquired its own field in the centre of the village. Entries increased over the years to a peak in the 1950's of nearly a thousand, but have since declined to the present level of between 400 and 500 in 158 classes. Support iin the early years came mainly from neighbouring villagers who came in the evening after work and joined in the evening sports. Now support is mainly from holiday visitors during the afternoon, who besides the Show, enjoy the Children's Fancy Dress and Sports.
